channel.title: BWCAW on Khaled Allen
channel.description: Recent content in BWCAW on Khaled Allen

item.title: Traits of a Warrior: Humility
item.description:
One of the most important lessons I've learned from CrossFit is humility. Workouts that sound easy never are, and I am always amazed at how quickly my muscles will tire, how a weight that sounds light quickly becomes unbearable. To make things worse, we are always talking about how some crazy CrossFitter completed the same WOD in unrealistically fast times. CrossFit is a community, and so we know that the same workout that destroyed everyone at our gym was a walk in the park for someone else. Personally, this is hard to swallow. I know I've made amazing strides since I started, but an unweighted barbell still gets painfully heavy after a few minutes, and burpees can still leave me begging for mercy.

To make things worse, I've come to learn that getting frustrated does not make things any better. After 5 months of training, my snatch max hasn't changed a single pound. But trying to use frustration to motivate myself only causes my technique to fall apart. There is a fine line between determination and frustration.
